snippet: There are times when Tom Campbell clearly relishes being the un-Republican Republican.    At such moments -- and he has had a lot of them lately -- Mr. Campbell, a congressman from Silicon Valley and the main contender for Dianne Feinstein's Senat...
lead_paragraph: There are times when Tom Campbell clearly relishes being the un-Republican Republican. At such moments -- and he has had a lot of them lately -- Mr. Campbell, a congressman from Silicon Valley and the main contender for Dianne Feinstein's Senate seat this election, rolls up his sleeves and unleashes the poetry of a progressive heavyweight, his style and substance remarkably like that of a Jesse Jackson or a Mario Cuomo.
abstract: Rep Tom Campbell, Republican, faces uphill battle to unseat Sen Dianne Feinstein in California, being perceived as too much of a Republican by state's Democrats and too much of a progressive by state's Republicans; Feinstein has a strong lead in polls and in fund-raising; photo (M)

headline.main: G.O.P. Long Shot Offers A Touch of the Radical
headline.kicker: THE 2000 CAMPAIGN: THE CALIFORNIA SENATE RACE
